definition: shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
shameful/ugly/disgraceful
surname Chou

sentences.english: Someone you least expect could be trying to make you look bad.
sentences.chinese: 有人可能会想让你出丑，这个人是你意想不到的。

sentences.english: He did not want to be pinnacled.
sentences.chinese: 他出丑还没有出到顶点。

sentences.english: “Don’t make a fool of yourself, ” I thought. “Just watch.”
sentences.chinese: “不要出丑”我思忖着“就看看吧。”

sentences.english: The competent person who blunders, this is the person that I love.
sentences.chinese: 有能力的人，偶尔出丑，大爱啊。

sentences.english: Are you afraid of looking a fool in public - of being a subject of ridicule?
sentences.chinese: 你害怕当众出丑，成为大家的笑料吗？

sentences.english: Sometimes public figures are liked even more after their pratfall.
sentences.chinese: 公众人物在出丑之后更加受人喜欢。

sentences.english: Mary likes to show people up in public.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽喜欢使别人当众出丑。

sentences.english: He abstained from televised debates with Ms Tymoshenko to avoid making gaffes.
sentences.chinese: 为避免出丑，他拒绝与季莫申科女士在电视上辩论。

sentences.english: Mark was very angry because Jane put him down before everyone.
sentences.chinese: 马克非常生气，因为简使他当众出丑。

sentences.english: Don't be fool here, we go home and discuss thg problerm.
sentences.chinese: 不要在这出丑，我们回家再谈。

sentences.english: How you tried to publicly humiliate me?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么想方设法要我当众出丑的？

sentences.english: Occasionally the gallery space makes an exhibition of itself.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔，画廊的空间被拿来当众出丑。

sentences.english: All officials were waiting to see Beigong She's gaffe.
sentences.chinese: 文武百官于是都在旁等着看北宫奢如何出丑。

sentences.english: Just remember, others could be trying to "set you up" just so you over-react & look like a fool…
sentences.chinese: 要记住，别人可能就是想要你出丑，所以要保持冷静。

sentences.english: Note that if you humiliate one person it has a ripple effect.
sentences.chinese: 要知道如果你让一个人出丑了，将会产生涟漪效应。

sentences.english: Get up off the floor and stop making such an exhibition of yourself.
sentences.chinese: 从地上爬起来，别再当众出丑了。

definition: to make a fool of oneself
to lose face
(coll.) to have sth embarrassing happen
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to be put on the spot/to find oneself in an awkward situation
social gaffe or blunder/faux pas/see 出洋相[chu1 yang2 xiang4]
to lose face/humiliation
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to lose face
shameful performance/disgraceful situation
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to tease/to make fun of
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
hard to take/embarrassed
posturing/pretentious/affected
